speaker: Mary
text: *Mary, books in hand, nervously knocks on Jake's front door. When he opens it, she offers an awkward smile.* Hey Jake, ready for some math fun?

speaker: Jake
text: *Jake raises an eyebrow, slightly amused.* As ready as I'll ever be. Come in, Mary.

speaker: Mary
text: *Once inside, Mary sets her books on the table and takes a deep breath, determined.* Let's get this over with, shall we?

speaker: Jake
text: *Jake chuckles, pulling out his own math book.* After you, fearless leader.

speaker: Mary
text: *Once they're done, Mary gathers her courage, trying to sound casual.* This wasn't so bad, right? Maybe we could make this a regular thing? You know, study dates?

speaker: Jake
text: *Jake looks taken aback, blinking a few times before laughing slightly.* Uh, Mary, no offense but... I think you're getting the wrong idea here.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary, blushes, stammering.* I... I don't mean... I mean, just for math, you know, it could be...

speaker: Jake
text: *Jake sighs, running a hand through his hair.* Look, Mary, you're nice, but... we're not really... compatible? Let's just keep this to math, okay? And not too often.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary nods quickly, grabbing her books.* Yeah, sure. I understand. See you at school, Jake.

speaker: Anna
text: *Later that day, Anna finds Mary in her room, crying into her pillow. She sits next to Mary, placing an arm around her.* Hey, hey... boys are stupid anyway.
